code.displayName: Reportability response report Document Public health
Reportable condition response information and summary Document

text.paragraph: Public Health Reporting Communication: one or more conditions are reportable, or may be reportable, to public health.

act.text: Subject:Public Health Reporting Communication: one or more conditions are reportable, or may be reportable, to public health.

text.paragraph: Your organization electronically submitted an initial case report to determine if reporting to public health is needed for a patient. "Zika virus disease (disorder)" is reportable to "State Department of Health". An initial case report was sent to "State Department of Health". Additional information may be required for this report.

paragraph.content: "Zika virus disease (disorder)" for "State Department of Health"

text.paragraph: Reporting is required within "24 hours". Reporting to this Public Health Agency is based on "both patient home address and provider facility address".
text.content: > Local mosquito-borne Zika virus transmission was reported in your area. Increased watchfulness for symptoms of Zika virus in your patients is warranted. (Immediate action requested)
> Zika has particular risks for pregnant women. Follow-up guidance for pregnant women and couples who are planning pregnancy. (Immediate action requested)
> Further Laboratory testing for Zika may be needed. Guidance for additional testing and specimen collection (Action requested)
> If you have additional questions regarding Zika or reporting, contact information for the State Department of Health is available here. (Information Only)

paragraph.content: > Control and prevention information for providers (Information only)

act.text: Your organization electronically submitted an initial case report to determine if reporting to public health is needed for a patient. 'Zika virus disease (disorder)' is reportable to 'State Department of Health'. An initial case report was sent to 'State Department of Health'. Additional information may be required for this report.

code.displayName: Both patient home address and provider facility address

playingEntity.name: State Department of Health Routing Agency

code.originalText: Local mosquito-borne Zika virus transmission was reported in your area. Increased watchfulness for symptoms of Zika virus in your patients is warranted.
Zika has particular risks for pregnant women. Follow-up guidance for pregnant women and couples who are planning pregnancy.

code.displayName: Additional detection and/or laboratory testing needs

code.originalText: Further Laboratory testing for Zika may be needed. Guidance for additional testing and specimen collection
If you have additional questions regarding Zika or reporting, contact information for the State Department of Health is available here.

code.displayName: Initial case report processing information Document
eICR was processed - with a warning

value.displayName: eICR was processed with the warning of: outdated RCTC version

test.label: MAY contain zero or more [0..*] participant (CONF:4482-1040).
The participant, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @typeCode=LOC location =(CONF:4482-1047).
The participant, if present, SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] associatedEntity (CONF:4482-1041).
This associatedEntity SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] @classCode=SDLOC (CONF:4482-1048).
ii. This associatedEntity SHALL contain at least one [1..*] id (CONF:4482-1042).
This associatedEntity SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] code(CONF:4482-1043).
This associatedEntity SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] US Realm Address (AD.US.FIELDED)(CONF:4482-1044).
This associatedEntity SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] scopingOrganization (CONF:4482-1045).
This scopingOrganization SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] name (CONF:4482-1052).
2. This scopingOrganization SHALL contain at least one [1..*] telecom (CONF:4482-1053)..
3. This scopingOrganization SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] US Realm Address (CONF:4482-1046).
